contents: (6) Rip currents form as incoming waves create an underwater sandbar close to shore (#1 diagram), and the waves push more and more water in between the sandbar and the shore (#2) until a section of this sandbar collapses and the water rushes back toward the sea (#3) through a narrow gap. (7) Once the flowing water passes through the narrow gap, it begins to spread out (#4). (8) It is here where the velocity and strength of the rip current circulation begins to weaken considerably.
